sources.title: Flying Leathernecks (1951) John Wayne · Robert Ryan
sources.description: War Action (1951) with John Wayne   The Pacific, during World War II: Commander Dan Kirby (John Wayne) makes many enemies with his harsh tone in the "Wildcat" fighter squadron.   Squadron Captain Carl Griffin, in particular, detests Kirby's reckless manner. It's only during a risky mission that the two men begin to understand each other.  Flying aces and great flight shots.

metadata.Plot: Major Daniel Kirby takes command of a squadron of Marine fliers just before they are about to go into combat. While the men are well meaning, he finds them undisciplined and prone to always finding excuses to do what is easy rather than what is necessary. The root of the problem is the second in command, Capt. Carl 'Griff' Griffin. Griff is the best flier in the group but Kirby finds him a poor commander who is not prepared to the difficult decision that all commanders have to make - to put men in harm's way knowing that they may be killed.
metadata.Writer: James Edward Grant, Kenneth Gamet, Beirne Lay Jr.
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, Robert Ryan, Don Taylor
